title: Bill of Materials (BOM)
description:
Bill of Materials (BOM) - Robot-Centric

BOM management tied to ROBOTS (not teams). Each robot has its own BOM.

Key Concept (from specification.md Section 1.3.1):
- Teams build multiple robots per season (e.g., 'Cheddar', 'Pepperjack', 'Parmesan')
- BOM is connected to a ROBOT, not directly to a team
- Robots can be disassembled and parts return to inventory
- bomItems reference robotId, not teamId

Features:
- BOM items linked to parts inventory via quantityAllocated
- Subsystem organization (drivetrain, intake, lift, etc.)
- Needed vs allocated comparison per robot
- Gap analysis (what needs ordering for this robot)
- One-click order creation for missing parts
- Part allocation workflow (allocate parts from inventory to robot BOM)

UI (from design spec Section 5.2.5):
- BOM page is per-robot: /teams/:teamId/robots/:robotId/bom
- Grouped by subsystem with collapsible sections
- Live inventory comparison with allocation status
- Allocation workflow: Allocate, Return to Inventory buttons
- Summary with coverage percentage

title: Parallel Bead Worker System
description:
Experiment with async subagents for parallel bead execution. Define orchestration patterns, document in AGENTS.md, and test with real bead work.

## Goals
- Enable main agent to dispatch multiple bead-workers in parallel
- Each worker autonomously completes a single bead
- Workers update bd status as they work
- Discovered work filed back to bd
- Main thread wakes only when needed (completion, blockers, cross-bead issues)

## Subagent Types
1. bead-worker: Completes single bead tasks (sonnet)
2. bead-reviewer: Reviews completed work (sonnet, read-only)
3. bead-coordinator: Monitors progress (haiku, lightweight)

## Rules
- Only dispatch beads with no shared file dependencies
- Check bd dep tree to avoid blocked beads
- Max 3-4 concurrent workers
- Keep delegation flat (main -> workers only)

title: Build part allocation workflow
description:
Implement the workflow to allocate parts from inventory to a robot's BOM.

Context: When parts are added to a robot's BOM, they need to be 'allocated' from the team's inventory.

Allocation Flow:
1. User views robot BOM page
2. For each BOM item showing 'Gap' (needed > allocated):
   - 'Allocate' button appears
3. Click 'Allocate' opens dialog:
   - Shows: Part name, Needed: X, Currently Allocated: Y, Available in Inventory: Z
   - Input: Quantity to allocate (default: min of gap or available)
   - Confirm/Cancel
4. On confirm:
   - Update bomItem.quantityAllocated += allocated amount
   - No change to parts table (inventory is calculated)
5. Success toast

Return to Inventory Flow:
1. For items with quantityAllocated > 0, 'Return' button appears
2. Click shows dialog:
   - Input: Quantity to return (default: all allocated)
3. On confirm:
   - Update bomItem.quantityAllocated -= returned amount
4. Success toast

Inventory Calculation:
- Available = parts.quantity - SUM(bomItems.quantityAllocated for all robots in team)
- This is calculated, not stored

API Endpoints:
- POST /api/teams/:teamId/robots/:robotId/bom/:bomItemId/allocate
  Body: { quantity: number }
- POST /api/teams/:teamId/robots/:robotId/bom/:bomItemId/return
  Body: { quantity: number }

Verification:
